description: Validate that agent detects snake_case and other naming violations
must_catch_issues: Constants max_retry_attempts and default_timeout_ms should use UPPER_CASE (MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS, DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_MS)
Interface properties user_name and remember_me should use camelCase (userName, rememberMe)
Type alias auth_result should use PascalCase (AuthResult)
Type property expires_at should use camelCase (expiresAt)
Class properties database_service and session_timeout should use camelCase
Methods authenticate_user, verify_password, generate_token, calculate_expiration should use camelCase
Variables is_password_valid, expires_at, expiration_ms should use camelCase

naming_violations.issue: Constant using snake_case instead of UPPER_CASE
Constant using snake_case instead of UPPER_CASE
Interface using snake_case instead of PascalCase
Property using snake_case instead of camelCase
Property using snake_case instead of camelCase

Property using snake_case instead of camelCase

Method using snake_case instead of camelCase
Method using snake_case instead of camelCase
Method using snake_case instead of camelCase
Function using snake_case instead of camelCase

expected_fixes: Rename all constants to UPPER_CASE (MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS, DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_MS)
Rename interfaces and types to PascalCase (UserCredentials, AuthResult)
Rename interface/type properties to camelCase (userName, rememberMe, expiresAt)
Rename all class properties and methods to camelCase
Rename all variables to camelCase throughout
expected_agent_message: Found 15+ naming convention violations. All TypeScript identifiers must follow conventions: UPPER_CASE for constants, PascalCase for classes/interfaces/types, camelCase for everything else.

perfect_score_criteria: Identifies that naming conventions are violated (doesn't need exact count)
Flags snake_case usage in multiple contexts (constants, classes, methods, variables)
Recognizes pattern of violations throughout file
Provides guidance on correct naming conventions
common_mistakes: Missing the naming violations entirely (-30 pts - this is the main test)
Only flagging some violations, not recognizing pattern (-15 pts)
Not categorizing by severity correctly (-5 pts)
Not providing specific renaming guidance (-5 pts)
edge_cases: Agent doesn't need to count exact violations (approximate is fine)
Agent may also flag other minor issues (OK)
Different terminology for naming conventions acceptable

metadata.real_world_scenario: Python/JavaScript developer new to TypeScript, using familiar snake_case patterns
